pageContext.claim: “For our nation's veterans, we are improving pain management with over 43,000 fewer veterans on opioids since January 2017. Think of that, 43,000.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump suggests this from his own initiative, giving a statistic that dates from when he took the oath of office. The Veterans Administration launched the Opioid Safety Initiative long before Trump became president -- in October 2013. "Since its launch, the program managed a 45 percent reduction in veteran patients receiving opioids from July 2012 to June 2018. That’s more than 300,000 fewer veterans on opioids," said Veterans Secretary Robert Wilkie in an opinion article published in late 2018.
